moves.3... g5: g5 most popular.  I like Be7 personally.
moves.4. Bc4: Gotta love that Bishop on c4.  Always a threat to sacrifice if White wants to really rip up Blacks Kingside defenses.
moves.5. O-O: Lining up the artillery on "f" file.
moves.5... d6: Weak Imo.  White Bishop remains a threat.
moves.8. g3: Attempting to draw off Black pawn on f4.
moves.8... g4: Black makes a play for the White Knight.
moves.9... f3: Black declines the pawn on g3 and pushes the attack deeper into White territory.
moves.10. Nxf3: Knight sacrifices to blunt the advancing Black pawns, and also to open up attack lane f.
moves.11. Bxf7+: White deeply in debt, dives in even deeper with the Bishop sac.  Gotta love the KGA!
moves.11... Kxf7: White down by 5 pts, but Black King is now exposed on "f" file.
moves.12... Kg8: Black blunders here, not wanting to surrender his Knight by playing Nf5.
moves.13. Qf7+: Black King on the run now!
moves.13... Kh7: King forced to the wall.  Black Bishop now pinned.
moves.14. Rf6: This makes mate possible if Black misses the potential  Rxh6.
moves.15. Qg6+: White still deeply in debt opts for a forced draw, seeing he cannot force a mate, and seeing his opponent has a 300 pt. ratings edge.  Lots of excitement in this game.  KGA can be a willy nilly slugfest where almost anything can happen if the slightest error is made.  Gotta LOVE KGA!
